medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual health until approximately 1 week before admission, when a painful, pruritic rash developed on her chin, neck, and chest; it gradually spread to involve her entire body, sparing the palms, soles, and genitalia. Four days before admission, the rash was similar to but more severe than her usual atopic dermatitis. On the following day, the rash persisted, chills developed, and the temperature rose to 39.4Â°C. Pain and discomfort increased with movements or pressure on the skin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of atopic dermatitis since childhood, history of asthma, flare of atopic dermatitis after treatment with trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, depression and anxiety, and cervical intraepithelial neoplasia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of ovarian cancer; multiple paternal relatives had atopic dermatitis.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked five cigarettes a day, did not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, moved to New England 2 weeks ago, lived with boyfriend who owns a cat and has a history of cold sores.
